## R Markdown

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

```{r cars}
library(tidyverse) 
library(readr)
library(dplyr)

###syphilis rate in preg women###
syphi_raw <- read_csv("syphilis rate in preg women.csv")

head(syphi_raw)

syphi <- syphi_raw %>% filter(IsLatestYear=="TRUE") %>% select(`Location`,`Period`, `FactValueNumeric`)

#table(syphi$Period)
#Solomon islands 2017 data might be typo in the original dataset, so we manually input their 2015 data 

syphi$Period[which(syphi$Location=="Solomon Islands")] <- 2015
syphi$FactValueNumeric[which(syphi$Location=="Solomon Islands")] <- 13.2


###infant mortality rate###
infant_raw <- read_csv("infant mortality rate.csv")

head(infant_raw)
infant <- infant_raw %>% filter(IsLatestYear=="TRUE", Dim1 == "Both sexes") %>% select(`Location`,`Period`, `FactValueNumeric`)


```
